metadata.description: Pre-tested terrain generation recipes for VibeCraft using WorldEdit noise functions

noise_functions.perlin: Classic smooth noise - ideal for rolling hills and natural variation
noise_functions.ridgedmulti: Sharp-edged noise - perfect for mountains and rocky terrain
noise_functions.voronoi: Cell-based noise - good for cracked/cellular patterns

rolling_hills.name: Gentle Rolling Hills
rolling_hills.description: Smooth, undulating hills perfect for pastoral landscapes, farms, or gentle countryside
rolling_hills.visual: Broad, smooth waves like ocean swells frozen in earth
rolling_hills.formula: y = y + round(perlin(seed, x/scale, 0, z/scale, frequency, octaves, persistence) * amplitude)

rugged_mountains.name: Rugged Mountains
rugged_mountains.description: Sharp peaks and ridges reminiscent of alpine ranges
rugged_mountains.visual: Jagged peaks with sharp ridgelines, like the Rockies or Alps
rugged_mountains.formula: y = y + round(ridgedmulti(seed, x/scale, 0, z/scale, frequency, octaves) * amplitude)

valley_network.name: Valley Network
valley_network.description: Interconnected valleys and depressions, ideal for river systems
valley_network.visual: Branching valleys like veins, natural water flow paths
valley_network.formula: y = y - round(abs(perlin(seed, x/scale, 0, z/scale, 1.0, octaves, 0.5)) * depth) + 3

mountain_range.name: Directional Mountain Range
mountain_range.description: Linear mountain chain running in a specific direction
mountain_range.visual: Long ridgeline running across the landscape, like the Andes or Himalayas

plateau.name: Plateau with Rough Edges
plateau.description: Flat-topped elevated area with natural, irregular edges
plateau.visual: Flat top with eroded, irregular cliff edges
plateau.formula: y = y + round(height * (1 - smoothstep(0, 1, (sqrt((x-cx)^2 + (z-cz)^2) / radius) + perlin(seed, x/15, 0, z/15, 1.0, 3, 0.5) * roughness)))

temperate.name: Temperate Forest/Grassland
temperate.description: Lush green landscape with grass, dirt, and moss
temperate.visual: Green rolling hills with earthen tones

alpine.name: Alpine/Snow-Capped
alpine.description: High-altitude mountain peaks with snow and exposed stone
alpine.visual: White peaks with gray stone showing through

desert.name: Desert/Arid
desert.visual: Golden and red earth tones, sandy texture

volcanic.name: Volcanic/Lava Zone
volcanic.description: Dark igneous rock with magma flows
volcanic.visual: Black and dark gray with orange glow from lava

jungle.name: Tropical Jungle
jungle.visual: Deep green with brown earth, very organic

swamp.name: Swamp/Wetland
swamp.visual: Brown and green, looks damp and organic

simple_hills.description: Quick rolling hills for a village site

mountain_fortress.description: Dramatic mountain backdrop for a castle

river_valley.description: Valley system for river and settlements

steps.note: Add water manually: //set water in valley floor

planning: Start with a flat or gently sloping base terrain
Define clear selection boundaries before deforming
Test on small areas (50x50) before applying to large regions
Keep amplitude under 30 blocks to avoid extreme cliffs
execution: Always smooth after deformation (2-3 iterations minimum)
Apply texturing AFTER terrain shaping is complete
Use masks to protect existing builds during terrain edits
Save backups or //copy the area before major changes
combining_features: Layer multiple noise functions for complex terrain
Use valleys + hills together for varied landscape
Add plateau on top of hills for unique formations
Combine mountain range with perpendicular valleys for realism

troubleshooting.operation_timeout: Reduce region size or increase command timeout

layering_noise.description: Combine multiple noise functions for ultra-realistic terrain
layering_noise.example: Apply gentle hills first, then overlay valleys for complexity

conditional_texturing.description: Use masks to texture based on height or block type
conditional_texturing.example: //gmask >y65 then overlay snow for alpine effect

erosion_simulation.description: Use smoothing with selective masks to simulate water erosion
erosion_simulation.example: Heavy smoothing in valleys, light smoothing on peaks

custom_expressions.description: Write your own deform expressions for unique effects
custom_expressions.example: Combine perlin + ridgedmulti in single expression for hybrid terrain
